column2: Urdu: رِينالہ خُورد‎) is a growing city in the Okara District in the northeast Punjab province of Pakistan. Khurd is a Persian word meaning small.

column1: The city is the headquarters of Renala Khurd Tehsil
column2: an administrative subdivision of the district. It is approximately 570 feet (170 m) above sea level.

column1: The city is about 116 kilometres (72 mi) from Lahore and 18 kilometres (11 mi) from the district capital city of Okara. It is southwest of Lahore on the national highway (GT Road) and on the Lahore Karachi main railway line. Renala Khurd operates on PKT.

column3: 000 inhabitants. The population of Renala Khurd is over 90% Muslim. It has a Sunni majority and a Shia minority; there are also small groups of Christians

column1: Due to its strategic location in the Indian sub-continent
column2: many migrants have poured into the area and settled on its fertile lands. The people of Renala Khurd are descendants of Iranians
column4: Afghans and Arabs who came individually or in groups.

column2: previously known as the University of Education Okara campus
column3: is 1 km west of the city. It was inaugurated in 2005 by then Prime Minister Shaukat Aziz.
